alert.note: Alert for Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 29 at 5:42AM PST until December 29 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather to Impact Mountain and Foothill Travel into Wednesday... .Moderate to locally heavy snow today. Snow levels continue to be low between 1000 and 2000 feet today. Check road conditions before traveling. Some roads may remain closed or impassable. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the morning commute. Additional wet snow accumulations of up to two inches are expected. * WHERE...Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley. * WHEN...Until noon today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for wet snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
